availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmworker. Kentucky native. Son of Daniel Fossett and Louisa Fossett. Student in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmworker with Samuel W. Fossett for Daniel Fossett in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 373A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 648.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 4, p. 445B.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film 7017481: All Counties: Pendleton County, 1923, File #12132, p. 2640 of 3313 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, “William Henry Fossett (1842-1923)," Memorial #68226667, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68226667/william-henry-fossett (accessed May 18, 2021).
